reviews.review_msg: I was hesitant about taking this class with a new instructor, but Hayley was a great choice. She was helpful in office hours and after class. Lectures are dense but overlap with the textbook. The 3 non-cumulative multiple choice exams are very easy if you put the work in. Group presentation is confusing. Easiest psychology class I've taken at SFU.

Your typical psyc class with some extra triggering stuff. Lectures are boring & notes are disorganized so your best shot is to study the textbook for the exam. Which btw is like $200 and there's only one in the library, in reserved section no less. Cherry on top there's a term project group presentation. Not recommended - there are better courses.
